node.title: New residents breathe life into isolated town on Tasmania's wild West Coast
node.alt: A woman and man sit on a brown leather couch with a dog and a goat.
node.description: Queenstown's main street is reminiscent of a bygone era — once the hub of a booming mining town but now with many buildings fallen into disrepair.
node.content:
["Queenstown's main street is reminiscent of a bygone era. Once the hub of a booming mining town, it now has many buildings in disrepair.", "Now, new residents are moving in and breathing new life into the isolated town on Tasmania's West Coast.", "It's been a quarter of a century since Orr Street's Hunters Hotel was open for business,\u00a0but it won't be closed for much longer.", "Restoring the neglected pub has been a labour of love for mainlanders Ralph and Renate Wildenauer. It's been a dream of theirs\u00a0since they first laid eyes on the building five years ago.", "\"The hotel looked so bad when we bought it, all the windows were smashed and boarded up with corrugated iron and paint was flaking off. It looked really, really sad,\" Mr Wildenauer said.", "", "
Ralph and Renate Wildenauer say preserving the hotel is about saving it for future generations.(ABC News: Alexandra Humphries)
", "The couple had initially planned for a 12-month turnaround, but health problems, council hold-ups and hefty fines, and difficulty getting tradespeople on the west Coast, added years to the project.", "They are now hoping it will reopen early next year.", "", "
Hunters Hotel proprietors Renata and Ralph say they are \"very pleased with the result\".(ABC News: Alexandra Humphries)
", "\"Doing up an old building, you pull off one bit and discover more to do than you thought there would be.", "\"We're nearly finished now and it's looking stunning. We're very pleased with the result.\"", "", "
A renovated room inside Ralph and Renate Wildenauer's\u00a0Hunters Hotel in Queenstown, Tasmania.(ABC News: Alexandra Humphries)
", "
A town crying to be revitalised
", "The Wildenauers are not alone in working to transform Queenstown's streetscape.", "Just up the road, New South Wales expats Jon and Banksy Williams are turning the old butcher's shop into a wine bar, and the neighbouring 1940s shopfront into a mountain biking business, after it was left shuttered for 13 years.", "\u00a0\"It's just nice to put love back into something,\" Ms Williams said.", "\"We've worked really hard to get to where we are, and we do all the renos and everything ourselves. It's\u00a0lots of hard work but it's really rewarding.", "\"We've had so much positive feedback from all the locals.\"", "", "
The old butcher's shop is being transformed into a welcoming space.(ABC News)
", "The family of six moved to Queenstown after falling in love with the area, adopting a dog and a goat along the way.", "Ms Williams called it a \"mid-life awakening.\"", "West Coast Mayor Shane Pitt said Queenstown has\u00a0been crying out for some of the main street's older buildings to be revitalised.", "", "
\u00a0Banksy Williams says the family has received positive feedback from the community on\u00a0their renovations.(ABC News)
", "\"It's the vibrant atmosphere in the community that we want to see, and a new building or buildings that have been renovated certainly opens up that tourism industry as well,\" he said.", "For Ralph Wildenauer, preserving the hotel has also been about saving it for future generations.", "\"The fact that we've been able to achieve this, by ourselves, and that it looks so good, that's the thing that really makes it worth it,\" he said."]
